displaytitle: The Valley of the Catskill from Jefferson Hill
medium:
Recto: Pen and black ink and gray wash over graphite
Verso: Graphite
creditline: Gift of Miss Elizabeth Huntington Moore, the artist's daughter, presented by Mrs. Frank Jewett Mather, Jr.
inscribed:
in black ink, lower left: The Valley of the Catskills from Jefferson Hill
in graphite, on verso upper left, partially amputated from cutting of sheet: [fin]ally abandoned because I hope to make | [an]other series illustrating the Hudson River | [from] its source to the sea-& these plates | [woul]d more naturally [crossed out] properly belong to this last. | ---- | [ri]ver series show all the characteristic crops -- Barges | , schoones [sic], tugs, canal-tugs, steamers, small sail- | boats -- ice-boats --ice getting -- ice houses -- | -yards -- Rail-roads &c&c --Mills & Bridges | -side --Head Quarters, Fort Putnam, Fort Lee -- Falls, | ds, Palisades, Bay & City-
signed: Signed and dated in black ink, lower right: C.H.Moore.1869
